title: Vintage Hat Styles
description: Test your knowledge of the hats that topped off every outfit from the 1940s through the 1970s!

questions.question: Which small, brimless hat sat atop the head and was famously worn by Jacqueline Kennedy?
questions.explanation: The pillbox hat, a small cylindrical hat with a flat top, became iconic when Jackie Kennedy wore one designed by Halston at the 1961 inauguration.

questions.question: What type of men's hat, with a creased crown and a medium brim, was the go-to business hat of the 1940s and 1950s?
questions.explanation: The fedora was the standard hat for well-dressed men from the 1940s through the late 1950s, worn daily with suits to work.

questions.question: Which close-fitting, bell-shaped women's hat, popular in the 1920s, made a comeback in 1960s fashion?
questions.explanation: The cloche hat, which fits closely over the head and frames the face, was revived in the 1960s as part of a retro fashion trend.

questions.question: What wide-brimmed straw hat became a summer staple for women in the 1950s and 1960s?
questions.explanation: The picture hat, with its dramatic wide brim, was a glamorous summer accessory in the 1950s and 1960s, often seen at garden parties and outdoor events.

questions.question: Which hat style, made of stiff felt with a rounded crown, was commonly associated with British businessmen and was also called a 'derby' in America?
questions.explanation: The bowler hat (called a derby in America) was a staple of formal menswear, though it gradually fell out of everyday fashion by the 1960s.

questions.question: What type of draped fabric headwear was popular among glamorous women in the 1940s, partly due to wartime fabric restrictions?
questions.explanation: Turbans became fashionable in the 1940s as they could be made from small amounts of fabric during wartime rationing, while also being glamorous.

questions.question: What crocheted or knitted hair accessory that enclosed the hair at the back of the head was widely worn by women during World War II?
questions.explanation: Snoods were practical and fashionable during WWII, keeping women's hair safely contained while working in factories and adding a touch of style.

questions.question: Which flat-crowned straw hat with a ribbon band was popular for men's summer wear in the early-to-mid 20th century?
questions.explanation: The boater (or skimmer) hat, made of stiff straw with a flat crown and brim, was a classic men's summer hat popular through the 1950s.

questions.question: What small, decorative women's hat was often pinned at a jaunty angle and adorned with feathers or netting in the 1950s?
questions.explanation: Cocktail hats were small, decorative hats worn tilted on the head, often embellished with veiling, feathers, or flowers for dressy occasions in the 1950s.

questions.question: Which men's hat, similar to a fedora but with a narrower brim turned up in the back, became popular with jazz musicians?
questions.explanation: The trilby, with its shorter brim turned up at the back, became associated with jazz culture and was popular from the 1950s onward.

questions.question: What fur hat with ear flaps became a practical and fashionable winter choice in the 1950s and 1960s?
questions.explanation: Trapper hats (similar to Russian ushankas) with their warm fur and fold-down ear flaps were popular winter headwear in the 1950s and 1960s.

questions.question: Which type of hat, woven from toquilla straw in Ecuador, was a prized men's accessory and is named after a different country?
questions.explanation: Panama hats, despite their name, are actually made in Ecuador. They became popular when workers building the Panama Canal wore them.

questions.question: In which decade did men largely stop wearing hats as everyday accessories, marking the end of the 'hat era'?
questions.explanation: The 1960s saw the decline of men's daily hat-wearing. JFK's bare-headed inauguration in 1961 is often cited as a symbolic turning point, though the trend was already shifting.

questions.question: What type of women's hat featured an extremely wide, floppy brim and was fashionable in the late 1960s and 1970s?
questions.explanation: Floppy sun hats with wide, soft brims became a bohemian fashion staple in the late 1960s and 1970s, epitomizing the free-spirited style of the era.

questions.question: Which hat company, founded in 1865, was the largest hat manufacturer in America and a household name through the mid-20th century?
questions.explanation: The Stetson Hat Company, founded by John B. Stetson in 1865, became America's most famous hat maker, producing everything from cowboy hats to dress fedoras.
